issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: BlockPlacementPolicyRackFaultTolerant fails with racks with very few nodes

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
HDFS-12567 tries to fix the scenario where EC blocks may not be allocated in extremely rack-imbalanced cluster.

The added fall-back step of the fix could be improved to do a best-effort placement. This is more likely to happen in testing than in real clusters.
fields.summary: BlockPlacementPolicyRackFaultTolerant fails with very uneven racks

comments.body:
Patch 1 to reproduce the error and fix.
This keeps the {{getMaxNodesPerRack}} calculation so normal placements can still be as even as possible. Modified unit test fail-before-pass-after.

In real clusters this come in the form of message {{Cannot allocate parity block}} in the client and {{org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.blockmanagement.BlockPlacementPolicy: Failed to place enough replicas, still in need of 3 to reach 14}} in the NN.

[~andrew.wang] and [~eddyxu], could you take a look?

Patch 2 thanks for some chats with Eddy. Fun bug. :)

Added test to ensure {{BlockPlacementPolicyRackFaultTolerant}} still attempts to tolerate 1-rack-failure if the setup allows - it currently doesn't do that, so improved the best-effort code.
For anyone interested in debugging, you could temporarily just LOG.debug inside {{logNodeIsNotChosen}}. Otherwise the message is not shown - see HDFS-12726 for details.

Thanks for the review [~jojochuang]. Patch 3 to address the comments.

Initially wanted to let the loop in the test to make sure the over-by-1 is always on the lower numbers of the multi-node rack (e.g. if left 3 nodes for rack1 and rack2, rack1 always has 2 nodes). But that's not necessary for testing, so modified it to be the standard way.
